alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 05 at 11:31PM CDT until May 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR NORTHERN PHELPS...WESTERN BUFFALO...EAST CENTRAL GOSPER AND EASTERN DAWSON COUNTIES... At 1131 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Eddyville to 7 miles southwest of Miller to near Bertrand, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Miller around 1140 PM CDT. Amherst around 1145 PM CDT. Riverdale around 1155 PM CDT. Odessa around 1200 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 245 and 269. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
